historical_cultural_destinations.name: Sixty Dome Mosque
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site built in the 15th century by Khan Jahan Ali, famous for its 60 stone pillars and 77 domes.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Mahasthangarh
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: The oldest archaeological site in Bangladesh, once the capital of the ancient Pundra Kingdom dating back to the 3rd century BCE.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Paharpur Buddhist Vihara
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Somapura Mahavihara is one of the largest Buddhist monasteries in the Indian subcontinent.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Ahsan Manzil
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: The Pink Palace of the Nawabs of Dhaka, built in the 19th century as a symbol of luxury and Mughal architecture.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Lalbagh Fort
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: An incomplete Mughal fort complex started in 1678 by Prince Muhammad Azam, featuring a mosque, tomb, and gardens.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Mainamati Ruins
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A group of Buddhist archaeological sites dating back to the 8th–12th centuries, including the Salban Vihara.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Panam City
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: An abandoned 19th-century trading city of Hindu merchants, featuring colonial-era architecture and ancient mansions.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Bagha Mosque
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A 16th-century terracotta mosque built by Sultan Nusrat Shah, known for its intricate brick patterns.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Kantajew Temple
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A late 18th-century Hindu temple dedicated to Krishna, famous for its stunning terracotta panels and ornate carvings.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Star Mosque
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A striking Mughal-style mosque decorated with thousands of blue stars made of Japanese porcelain.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Sonargaon Folk Art and Craft Museum
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: Once the capital of medieval Bengal, Sonargaon now hosts a folk art museum preserving traditional crafts and heritage.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Idrakpur Fort
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A 17th-century Mughal fort built by Mir Jumla to protect Dhaka from pirates and invaders.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Shat Gambuj Bridge
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A 16th-century bridge with unique terracotta design built during the Sultanate period.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Bara Katra
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: One of Dhaka’s oldest Mughal-era caravanserais, built in the 17th century for merchants and travelers.

historical_cultural_destinations.name: Curzon Hall
historical_cultural_destinations.short_description: A grand colonial-era building named after Lord Curzon, now part of the University of Dhaka.
